attributes.action: Review the PIPs scoring system as being Dickensian & unfair in the 21st century.
attributes.background: The current review system is bias & unfair against disabled people who rely highly on access to places that abled people enjoy on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled people are made to feel like criminals during & following the reviews. They're made to apply for this benefit in a totally bias and unfair way on a claim form which asks 10 questions towards daily living but only 2 on mobility, which is the main purpose for disabled people applying for this benefit, in the first place. Maybe, if there must be 12 questions, a balance of 6 for daily living & 6 for mobility would be fairer & maybe provide a better view of a individuals needs?

attributes.action: Increase NI contributions and % of Gov. spending to meet the demands of the NHS.
attributes.background: The BBC were allowed into A&E depart. of the Royal Blackburn Hospital to witness the desperation of both patients and staff over a week. More investment in staff and accommodation was suggested by a consultant as a way forward. We should pay more for this invaluable institution which we all use.

attributes.action: Use our "special relationship" to persuade Trump to release his tax returns now.
attributes.background: The ordinary man has to pay tax, and has no choice in the matter. President Trump, as the leader of the free world, should set the example. He has claimed he paid millions in taxes, but has never proved it - Now he is president he should release his tax returns to back up his claims.

attributes.action: Delay the Disability benefit cuts due in April 2017
attributes.background: These cuts will have a devastating effect on one of the most vulnerable and needy groups

attributes.action: Invoice embassies based in the U.K. for NHS costs incurred by health tourists
attributes.background: The NHS is in danger of collapse. It cannot afford to treat people who come to the U.K. for healthcare and then refuse to pay for their treatment which often runs into hundreds of thousands of pounds. I believe that the country of origin should be held responsible and be made to pay.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary highlighted three cases, a woman from the Philipines who needed a quadruple heart bypass, a Turkish man in a similar situation and a woman who had fertility treatment abroad and after being refused entry to the USA, came to the U.K. and ran up a bill of over £300,000 at a London hospital. Three cases, almost £1,000,000 which will never be repaid and could be better spent on staff, services and equipment to treat people who qualify.

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Accept 10,000 refugee families into the UK, instead of Donald Trump
attributes.background: Accept 10000 Vulnerable refugee families into the UK and settle them using the money That would be otherwise spent on Trumps state visit
attributes.additional_details: Accept 10,000 vulnerable refugee families with children into the uk, instead of having Donald Trump here for a state visit. The money we would spend on hosting Trump to be used to bring over / settle the refugee families into UK city's, help them to learn English and find jobs while accepting and embracing their culture

attributes.action: Ban petitions calling for a ban on visits by heads of state invited by UK Govt
attributes.background: The media is full of 'news' on petitions calling for heads of states which have been invited by the UK Government to visit to be banned from visiting. This is a waste of resources and time, obviously the UK Govt has deemed it right that these people are invited in the first place.

attributes.action: Change the Discretionary Payment income cap.
attributes.background: The discriminatory payment income cap is much too low. A disabled family on all appropriate benefits falls much higher in income bracket to the aloud £15,000. This is discrimination against severely disabled families, as these people  successfully applied for community care grants and crisis loans.
attributes.additional_details: I myself have spoken to a member of the staff at the Discretionary Payment office and was refused a grant on the basis that my income was too high. The reason for my income being so high was not because of work or anything of the like, was simply because my daughter is so severely disabled and on high rate DLA that she was also entitled to disability component of child tax credit's. That entitlement to the disability component of child tax credit's is what put my and come over.  Discrimination.

attributes.action: call for uk prime minister may, to go to parliament & answers for NHS crisis
attributes.background: The British people deserve answers on why our country's greatest asset the NHS is turning the British people away & or leaving them to die in corridors, & it takes Red Cross to call you out don't cut staff & budgets, sort this its our human rights, Pm & government it's your fault not anyone else's
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for prime minister Theresa May to go to parliament and give answer to the British tax payer and it's people this is a disgrace people are dieing, needlessly under your power and government you have a lot of questions to answer, and don't blame the British public or the staff nurses or doctors, you have made the cuts to staff and hospitals budgets. please get this petition as far as we can as a great country, we're living in 3rd world conditions it's a disgrace. Fund NHS

attributes.action: More funding to domestic violence charities and provide more shelter for victims
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We believe not enough is done to support men and women who are victims of domestic violence. We want to see groups like Refuge get more funding to shelter victims and offer financial support to relocate them.

attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for Under 25's to £7.50 in line with all other workers.
attributes.background: Young people can be paid considerably less for work than an adult, in the same role at the same company; U18's can be paid as little as £4.05 per hour & U21 £5.60; This pay gap is discriminatory legislation, which says YP are worth less than older citizens (Regardless of ability to perform the job.)
attributes.additional_details:
It's near impossible to live a decent quality of life on earnings around the minimum wage; So why for under 25's who work in the same roles as adults can be paid £3.45p/h less an hour despite being potentially better educated more capable than their adult counterparts. Many under 25's work their jobs to help low-income parents provide necessities and I feel this discriminatory legislation therefore unfairly targets the young people of low-income backgrounds who are just about managing to cover the costs of running a household...

I therefore petition the government for pay equity for under 25's.

attributes.action: Stop the time limits on disabled and elderly bus passes.
attributes.background: The rules on a disabled or elderly bus pass is telling people who have them what times they can and can't take a bus journey Its discrimination and absolutely embarrassing to be turned away and declined to take your journey before 9am! Why have the bus pass holders got a bus pass curfew? Fair/Unfair
attributes.additional_details: Contact your local Council and ask for information on times you can use your bus pass. Its like we have to be controlled and they tell us what we can and can't do.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Election To Take Place 3 Months After Brexit.
attributes.background: Brexit has had huge impact not only on the economy, but has been divisive to the nation/s... for many people both brexiteers and remainers many have lost a lot of faith in the government ability and do not feel the government can take us forward to unite us and recover the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since Brexit, the countries division has been deep routed... And many people feel like their voices are not being heard. The government has been acting unilaterally ignoring a significant number of the population.

This has left very little confidence in the government's ability to fairly treat it's citizens. 

And the only way our voices will be heard is by holding a general election, to lead us in a positive direction and change.

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: make all care/rest homes have a percentage of locally funded beds
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to lose all their money, sell their property to pay for their care when they have to go into a care/residential home? Then when the money runs out, they have to move on?
attributes.additional_details: Care homes/Residential homes charge an extorionate rate for the care they provide, ranging from £800 to £1000+ per week. Some places are locally funded, whilst others are privately funded, meaning the person living there has to pay full price, for the care they receive. Locally funded places, will take into account someones pension, and will only pay some of the cost,leaving the person very little "pocket money". But atleast they have some money! All care homes/Residential homes, should allow for the fact that someones money will run out eventually and should make provisions for this, allowing the elderly person to go over to locally funded monies, without moving them on,so the elderly person, will be secure in the place they live, to live outtheir final days.

attributes.action: Regulate & cap the rent prices in London (RRR)
attributes.background: It's time for the government to take responsibility and stop ignoring their broken system. They should regulate and cap rent prices for rooms at the maximum of £550pcm. We want Responsibility, Regulation and Results (RRR).
attributes.additional_details:
Amongst all of the city wonders  London is known for its extremely high living costs - not to mention the extortionate prices private landlords are charging tenants. 

Due to inflation and low wages some Londoners are forced to work more than one job solely to pay the rent. 
 A lot of these landlords are illegally renting rooms and do not declare the income they are receiving from tenants and are charging tenants anything from £500-£850 for box rooms that can only fit a bed- this need to change!

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
attributes.additional_details:
** http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Infoservice/Presse/Meldungen/2016/161108-MRHH-Mohammad_Ali_Taheri.html?version=2
 
** https://www.gruene-bundestag.de/presse/pressemitteilungen/2016/november/iran-freiheit-fuer-mohammad-ali-taheri-15-11-2016.html
 
** http://shaheedoniran.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/SG-Report-UNGA2016.pdf

**http://www.petertatchellfoundation.org/tag/dr-taheri/

**https://www.amnesty.org.uk/blogs/urgent-action-network/my-teacher-needs-your-urgent-help

attributes.action: Add the option for 'None of the Above' on Local / General Election Ballot Papers
attributes.background: Voting is being effected by the lack of a direct, quantifiable outlet for frustrated people to express themselves.It causes negative voting and confused issues. People should have a way to say candidates/campaigns tactics are not good enough;if say 25% reached a rerun with new candidates triggered.
attributes.additional_details: Voting should be a positive experience. i.e FOR someone or something. Too often, the choice is often about the 'least worst option'. The ballot paper needs to give a credible alternative.The electorate needs a way to encourage postive campaigning and ultimately reject a set of bad candidates.I believe by giving everyone the option of quanitfiably registering their frustration with candidates/campaigns we can force politicians away from devisive language and personal attacks & increase turn out.

attributes.action: Ensure every UK home and business has access to a minimum of 2mb broadband.
attributes.background: All UK homes and businesses need access to a minimum 2mb broadband connection in order to benefit from the increasingly digital world. This should be universally completed, at no extra cost to customers, regardless of location and challenges, before any roll out of further improvements elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must introduce legislation to make this a minimum standard for all internet providers to meet.

attributes.action: Stop putting the clocks forward for British Summertime (BST) leave UK on GMT
attributes.background: The clocks changing for British Summertime started 100 years ago. The UK did this when Germany started doing it, apparently it was to save coal. Farmers have lights on their tractors and lights in their cattle sheds so this only serves to cause a nuisance for most of us. Especially those with kids

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: Reduce TV License Fee for full time students living away from home.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of full TV license for students living away from home, even for iPlayer is nonsensical as it will be ignored, not paid and cannot be policed.  A more pragmatic approach would be to have a nominal fee (eg £10) where students can provide parental details of cover at home address.

attributes.action:
Debate WAVE POWER v Fracking & Nuclear -  all 3 are Constant 
Sources of power.
attributes.background:
Other "constants" Fracking and Nuclear are dangerous and dearer, tax
gets lost, profits go overseas, amnesia over decommissioning & waste.

attributes.action: Stop advancement of religion being considered a charitable purpose.
attributes.background: The law recognises the advancement of religion as a charitable purpose. Religion includes all faiths and none  it includes a religion that does not have a belief in God. Advancing any belief system alone should not be considered charitable activity.
attributes.additional_details: Some belief systems may help people but assessing whether the beliefs themselves achieve benefit is subjective.  Public money through gift aid should not be available for this. Religious organisations should have to show other public benefit to qualify as charity and should only be allowed to use public money for that other purpose.

attributes.action: Stop the  plans, to use the hard shoulder on motorways, as an additional lane.
attributes.background: The plans to use the hard shoulder, on motorways, as an additional lane, is ill conceived and very dangerous. The hard shoulder is an EMERGENCY lane and should be kept as such. The emergency  and breakdown services will not be able to help drivers in the event of an accident or breakdown.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the emergency/breakdown services and motoring organisations, have already expressed their concern.

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Hinckley power station should be funded by the UK.
attributes.background: The country is asking foreign powers to provide and control our nuclear power. The rates of interest on the money put up is 9% and the guaranteed rate for electricity produced is such that we will suffer  from higher energy prices.
attributes.additional_details: Savers cannot obtain virtually any interest on their savings. They should be offered the opportunity of funding the project secured by the government at a rate of half that demanded by the French and Chinese. This would nevertheless allow them to invest in a project needed by the country but offering them  a reasonable return on their capital.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of kittens and puppies in pet shops
attributes.background: It is devastating to see that there are so many stray dogs and cats on the streets these days. Many are due to the fact that people go to pet stores, see an adorable little baby kitten or puppy and buy it on whim then further on down the line become bored and they end up in shelters up for adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent this drastically if pet shops stop selling puppies and kittens. It will force people to go to the shelter and adopt an animal from there or make them think about it instead of buying them on impulse. Some pet shops won't vet the home it is going to, to make sure it's going to the best home possible.
We ask for urgent action to raise awareness & encourage the public to choose a responsibly bred puppy/kitten with history information, or adopt from a legitimate rescue organisation.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: Increase funds and awareness of homeless shelters for young people on our street
attributes.background: Homeless Youth are far too often stereotyped as dangerous troublemakers. Change is needed, as homeless youth need to be noticed. We need to provide food, water and shelter. We need your help to raise awareness, and end homelessness in Youth for good. Help our cause. #itcouldbeme.
attributes.additional_details:
We are part of the Jackman Team, National Citizen Service (NCS) The Challenge, Wave 11, Croydon. Over the past week we have planned a campaign to help homeless Youth in our area on Friday 26th August 2016 in Croydon town centre.
Abuse, money loss, family bereavement are all causes of our new generation becoming homeless. Do we really want the future to be on our streets? Help our cause. Sign our petition. Together, we can end Youth homelessness for good.

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: Withhold aid from countries, such as Uganda, where homosexuality is a crime.
attributes.background: In many countries LGBT people suffer persecution simply for being what they are. They are disowned by their families and suffer death threats from relatives. They have no protection in law, instead police harass them and arrest them. They are in continual danger of prosecution and imprisonment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Pakistan

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Uganda

attributes.action: Introduce 100% Inheritance Tax At £10 Million
attributes.background: Don’t you wish to see the gap between the ultra-rich and the poor begin to narrow, instead of constantly widening? How can we even begin creating an even playing field where equal opportunity exists for everyone, while the colossal gap between privilege and poverty stares us in the face every day?
attributes.additional_details:
If no-one could pass on more than £10 million total to be divided between their heirs, we would see the gap between the rich and poor begin to narrow for the first time. 

A New Graded System could look like this :
40% IT payable after £750,000
50% IT payable after £1 million
60% IT payable after £2. 5 million
70% IT payable after £5 million
85% IT payable after £7. 5 million
100% IT payable after £10 million

100% IT could help properly fund the NHS, Education, Housing, Etc…  Please support it!

attributes.action: New generation social housing policy
attributes.background: It is an issue close to many of our hearts that too many people are without affordable and safe accommodation. That as a country we are not doing enough to provide affordable housing, specialist housing units for under 25's, mother and baby units for our future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
We are campaigning for a new policy dictating:-

- Housing to be provided only to those with 10+ years in the UK
- New Decent Homes Standards
- Rent assessed on affordability with a baseline on each property
- Annual property reviews including tenancy and accommodation
- New Tenancy Groups which deal with localised property repair issues
- More specialised properties including low rent properties, young peoples living, over 50's & mother and baby units
- New Housing Officer Role & Training

attributes.action: Stop the sale of student loans
attributes.background: The government wants to sell student loans off to help the treasury. Student loans are already hard enough to pay off in the current economic crisis. Many took them out because they had no choice and were assured they could pay. This has proven false. Selling them will cause more harm.

attributes.action: Add Welsh language education to the English school curriculum.
attributes.background: The Welsh language is spoken throughout both Wales and England and is arguably the native language of Great Britain, as well as 500,000 people. However, in England, the opportunity to learn Welsh is practically impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Give Welsh has an option in English schools to help promote cultural understand, give more people access to their ancestral language, help keep this magnificent language alive and create job opportunities for Welsh-speakers in England.
